questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : MARKET RESEARCH (COMPUTER BASED EXAM )" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : MARKET RESEARCH (COMPUTER BASED EXAM )" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?
question_texts: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?

questions.question_text_1: A company plans to do a house-to-house field survey to find the brand share of branded atta. The required sample size is 1000, spread across middle and upper income households
question_texts: A company plans to do a house-to-house field survey to find the brand share of branded atta. The required sample size is 1000, spread across middle and upper income households

questions.question_text_1: A hotel wants to do a customer satisfaction study over phone with guests who have checked out of the hotel after a minimum of 2 nights’ stay. The required sample size is 800 customers.
question_texts: A hotel wants to do a customer satisfaction study over phone with guests who have checked out of the hotel after a minimum of 2 nights’ stay. The required sample size is 800 customers.

parent_question.question_text_1: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?
question_texts: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?

questions.question_text_1: An FMCG firm wants to conduct a small sample study to understand how happy channel partners are with the support from the company. The required sample size is 20, and the nature of probing will be in-depth.
question_texts: An FMCG firm wants to conduct a small sample study to understand how happy channel partners are with the support from the company. The required sample size is 20, and the nature of probing will be in-depth.

parent_question.question_text_1: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?
question_texts: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?

questions.question_text_1: A baby products company plans to test out a new toothpaste concept meant for controlling tartar among people aged 50+. The targeted sample size is 25 and the probing will be qualitative in nature
question_texts: A baby products company plans to test out a new toothpaste concept meant for controlling tartar among people aged 50+. The targeted sample size is 25 and the probing will be qualitative in nature

parent_question.question_text_1: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?
question_texts: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?

questions.question_text_1: A retail chain that sells consumer durables wants to find out how satisfied its customers are and if they will come back to the stores. The company wants a sample size of 500 customers selected in such a way as to ensure proportionate representation to buyers of TV, buyers of washing machines etc.
question_texts: A retail chain that sells consumer durables wants to find out how satisfied its customers are and if they will come back to the stores. The company wants a sample size of 500 customers selected in such a way as to ensure proportionate representation to buyers of TV, buyers of washing machines etc.

parent_question.question_text_1: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?
question_texts: For each of the given situations in the subquestions , what sampling method is optimal?

questions.question_text_1: A manufacturer of moisturizing lotions wants to do a sample survey about the brand standing of its brand. It plans to do a house-to-house multistage cluster sampling survey. The company classifies its customers based on skin type (dry / oily) and age (Young / Middle-aged / Elder) and customizes its designs accordingly. The company wants to do the study in only one city. The company wants have a robust sample size with no compromises. What should be the sample size?
question_texts: A manufacturer of moisturizing lotions wants to do a sample survey about the brand standing of its brand. It plans to do a house-to-house multistage cluster sampling survey. The company classifies its customers based on skin type (dry / oily) and age (Young / Middle-aged / Elder) and customizes its designs accordingly. The company wants to do the study in only one city. The company wants have a robust sample size with no compromises. What should be the sample size?

questions.question_text_1: The same company now decides to do an ad recall study among its own customers and decides that the key metric will be the quality of recall measured on a 5 point scale from very poor to very good. The company wants to be 95% confident that the findings on the mean score on the 5 point scale is plus or minus 10% accurate. What should be the sample size?
question_texts: The same company now decides to do an ad recall study among its own customers and decides that the key metric will be the quality of recall measured on a 5 point scale from very poor to very good. The company wants to be 95% confident that the findings on the mean score on the 5 point scale is plus or minus 10% accurate. What should be the sample size?

questions.question_text_1: If the company instead decides that the key metric is the percentage of recall, and wants the same level of accuracy (plus or minus 10% accurate) and confidence (95%), then what should be the sample size?
question_texts: If the company instead decides that the key metric is the percentage of recall, and wants the same level of accuracy (plus or minus 10% accurate) and confidence (95%), then what should be the sample size?

questions.question_text_1: Based on the given example , answer the subquestions.  The family consists of retired Mr. M aged 85, Mr. R who is 54, his wife Mrs. A who is 49, and his daughter RK who is 25 (all of whom live in the same house in Bangalore)  Mr. R is a govt servant and runs the family on his salary, with some monetary support from his father Mr.M who gets a pension. Mrs. A has always been a homemaker and  continues to cook and keep house for the family. RK is setting up a business and has no settled earnings yet.
question_texts: Based on the given example , answer the subquestions.  The family consists of retired Mr. M aged 85, Mr. R who is 54, his wife Mrs. A who is 49, and his daughter RK who is 25 (all of whom live in the same house in Bangalore)  Mr. R is a govt servant and runs the family on his salary, with some monetary support from his father Mr.M who gets a pension. Mrs. A has always been a homemaker and  continues to cook and keep house for the family. RK is setting up a business and has no settled earnings yet.
